result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:36 PM Defendant John R Blasczyk in court, in custody.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for John R Blasczyk.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
All parties are ready to proceed on State's motion for forfeiture of wrong doing filed 9/16/22.  
Atty Schmidt calls Lt Bruckner who is sworn in and testifies.  
Atty Jochman cross examines the witness. 
Testimony closed. 
Court takes a recess. 
Matter recalled at 3:29 pm  Same appearances. 
Atty Schmidt gives closing statement.  
Atty Jochman makes closing statement. 
Court grants the motion for forfeiture of wrong doing as to reasons stated on the record. 
Matter remains as set.

2:49 PM Defendant John R Blasczyk in court, in custody.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for John R Blasczyk.  Attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.  
Both matters set for jury status and jury trial.  Motions are set for today. 
State addresses the joinder motion and states reasons on the record to have the matters joined. 
Atty Jochman objects to the motion for reasons stated on the record. 
Court grants motion to join and states reasons on the record.
Court addresses the other acts motion filed by the State. 
Atty Schmidt makes statements as to the other acts motion. 
Atty Jachman argues motion on the record. 
Court grants the States other acts motion along with defense other acts motion for reasons stated on the record. 
Court sets a motion hearing for forfeiture of wrong doing in this matter with counsel.  State will check the availability of the witness.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:20 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant John R Blasczyk in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Tyler Jochman, for attorney Thomas Paul Alberti.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the matter is before the Court on defense's motion to modify bail.  Atty. Jochman presents statements, he is asking the have the amount of cash bail lowered.  State objects and presents statements.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny the motion to modify bail; bail to remain as previously set.  Court notes the matter is set for further proceedings on May 23.  Atty. Jochman is requesting that date be adjourned to June.  Court will adjourn the further proceedings date set for May 23 to June.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
for Protective Order

to modify bail filed by Atty Alberti
  **Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen on 4/20/22 - Schedule a bail hearing.**
Hearing on May 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:20 AM Defendant John R Blasczyk in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas Paul Alberti.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tempelis indicates the State's witness did not get notice of today's date so we would need to pass this case to allow for the State to get a witness here.  Court takes a recess at 9:22 AM.  Matter recalled at 11:08 AM with the same appearances.  ADA Randy Sitzberger sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Tempelis.  Cross examination by Attorney Alberti.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Alberti objects to bind over with argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Attorney Thomas Alberti

Proposed Protective Order
The original document name was titled: Proposed Protective Order
The original history event date is: 04-05-2022

ADDRESS INFO for John R Blasczyk
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 04-05-2022)
Prior: 9 Sams Court, Madison, WI 53716

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1.5 miles of Victim A/Victim B, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:56 PM Defendant John R Blasczyk in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
